title: The Phantom Slack Message
setting: Crestline Consulting, open-plan office, Wednesday 9 AM
premise: A bizarre message reading 'Free pizza in the parking lot' was sent from CEO Margaret's unlocked laptop to the #general Slack channel at 3:12 PM Tuesday, while Margaret was in a board meeting.

suspects.name: Raj Patel
suspects.motive: Known office prankster with a history of Slack jokes
suspects.alibi: I was in the third-floor conference room rehearsing my quarterly presentation with Amy from 2:45 to 3:30 PM. She was timing each of my practice runs.

suspects.name: Lena Kowalski
suspects.motive: Frustrated that Margaret never locks her laptop despite repeated reminders
suspects.alibi: I was at my desk outside Margaret's office sorting mail the entire afternoon. I stepped away only once at 3:00 to refill my water bottle on the second floor.

suspects.name: Derek Chang
suspects.motive: Wanted to embarrass Margaret after she criticized his budget report
suspects.alibi: I was working at my desk on the second floor all afternoon. I had a video call with our London office from 2:30 to 3:45 that was recorded.

suspects.name: Sophie Brennan
suspects.motive: Wanted to prove a point about cybersecurity during Security Awareness Week
suspects.alibi: I was conducting new-hire orientation in the first-floor training room from 2:00 to 4:00 PM. Six new employees were with me in the room the whole time.

clues.title: Amy's Account
clues.content: Amy confirms she practiced presentations with Raj, but says they started at 3:15 PM, not 2:45 PM. She remembers because she was late and apologized.

clues.title: Elevator Records
clues.content: The elevator log shows no trips to the third floor between 2:50 and 3:20 PM. The only way up is the elevator or the stairwell next to Margaret's office.

clues.title: Floor Layout Note
clues.content: Margaret's office is on the third floor. The CEO's laptop was on her desk inside her private office, door left open while she was in the adjacent boardroom.

hints.text: Focus on the exact times each suspect says they were busy -- do their stories hold up to the minute?
If someone's scheduled companion remembers a different start time, that leaves a suspicious gap.
